title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: tide -flow tiddlers generated external script, often scheduled ran specific times. Data flow wiki. aim help build overview day passed, parallell tiddlywiki note taking; happened news day? weather like? web sites enjoy? receive important emails? files work ? Demonstration early version: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kBH73OoaL9o First warning: mostly proof--concept trusted valuable data. Use risk keep backups! get started, need initiate tiddlywiki server. create tiddlywiki server location,1 relative R working directory. start server R: path can absolute path relative R working directory. Within folder, package create following directories: file-archive. Files moved inbox inbox. folder copy stuff outbox. Currently used, idea scripts can put things web-archive. Archived web sites saved .wiki. wiki living script also add certain tiddlers tiddlywiki: $:/tide/ tiddlers include custom viewtemplates, scripts settings. $:/config/Server/ExternalFilters/[prefix[$:/tide]]. get access tide tiddlers. $:/config/SyncSystemTiddlersFromServer. get access tide tiddlers. Note tides saved prefix $:/tides/ ($:/tide/) separate controlling scripts. default, tide scripts tagged DoNotRun. remove tag activate scripts (use run_tides(force_run = TRUE)). run tide scripts, R:
code: library(myTideR) init("../my_tide") # path to your tide folder p <- start_server(tidepath="../my_tide") run_tides()

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: MultiWikiServer Plugin plugin currently development introduces recipes bags, stores tiddlywiki SQLite database instead flat files. several benefits, including performance. use MWS plugin, need download git repository tiddlywiki initiate server (replace "../TiddlyWiki5") relative path downloaded repository: can later retrieve whether tides lives MWS wiki checking tiddler called $:/tide/settings/mws:
code: library(myTideR) init("../my_tide", mws = TRUE, tiddlywiki = "../TiddlyWiki5") mws <- tides[title == "$:/tide/settings/mws", text] == "yes"

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: RSS channels tiddlers prefix $:/tide/settings/RSS/. example, rss_publisher rss_url used script. ran, tide tiddlers titles like $:/tides/RSS/<uuid>. Please note script tested RSS NRK, adaption may needed add channels.
code: title: $:/tide/settings/RSS/NRK Innenriks rss_publisher: NRK Innenriks rss_url: https://www.nrk.no/norge/toppsaker.rss type: text/vnd.tiddlywiki text: NRK Innenriks

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: file tide archive files added inbox folder create corresponding tiddlers. files moved file-archive/<file creation date>. tiddlers contain file metadata, well links files . protection colliding file names duplicates (hash), ’s guarantee data loss. Note: Chrome won’t let open local files default way, need install extension open external files browser.

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: hook tide allows “things” -text using hooks. example, , call TODO, SECRET SUMMARY hooks. identified following ::. default behavior content moved separate tiddler, titled something like $:/tides/hook/HOOK/<uuid> (HOOK example SECRET, TODO SUMMARY), transcluded original tiddler {{$:/tides/hook/HOOK/<uuid>||$:/tides/hook/HOOK}} (.e., $:/tides/hook/HOOK acting template). feel free implement advanced hook actions. example, may useful hook DOI::<doi>:: fetches doi record, creates tiddler , make appropriate link.
code: This is some tiddler content. You can have a TODO::todo element:: or perhaps a SECRET::little secret::. Or perhaps a SUMMARY:: This is a multiline summary ::

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: web tide archive web pages listed reference fields tiddlywiki. Using single-file, web pages downloaded web-archive folder, reference updated point tiddler instead original link. Note: need install single-file cli system!

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: mail tide quite similar file tide; drag--drop mails outlook (.msg) inbox folder, tide create tiddler mail archive attachments (run file tide). tide requires https://github.com/hrbrmstr/msgxtractr. Please note: tide_order field ensures mail tide runs file tide.

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: Import events calendars listed corresponding dates.

what: The YouTube history tide (not implemented yet)
title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: Following Google Takeout, import youtube history see videoes used enjoy past.

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: Import Spotify history remember songs used listen .

what: The Google Maps tide (not implemented yet)
title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: Following Google Takeout, import google location history see spent days.

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: TiddlyWiki perfect interface everything. However, perfect get overview data. tide imports LogSeq/obsidian files (intended read-).

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: Makes entry tiddlywiki entries Zotero database.

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: general, tide scripts look like : tiddlers tides datatables provided myTideR packages (note can keep backticks!). , tiddlers tides loaded run run_tides(). Note: need include do_some_stuff(tiddlers, tides) end script actually run code notes: careful changing pre-existing tiddlers tides. Since tiddlers fetched run_tides(), risk local copy getting --sync server rewrite tiddler multiple times. example, file inbox folder path can fetched read full_file_path <- normalizePath(file.path(tides[title == "$:/tide/settings/path", text], "inbox"), mustWork = FALSE)
code: ```r do_some_stuff <- function(tiddlers, tides) {   ... }  do_some_stuff(tiddlers, tides) ```

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: want use MWS plugin, scripts may benefit defining tide_recipe field defines recipe write resulting tiddlers . example, RSS tide put tiddlers specific recipe:
code: mws <- tides[title == "$:/tide/settings/mws", text] == "yes" recipe <- ifelse(mws, tides[title == "$:/tide/scripts/RSS", tide_recipe], "default")

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: Requires read write tide scripts file Write tide log files tiddlywiki Make import gmail files well

title: Authors and Citation
text: Anders H. Jarmund. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jarmund (2024). myTideR: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em !. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://andjar.github.io/myTideR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {myTideR: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!},   author = {Anders H. Jarmund},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://andjar.github.io/myTideR/}, }

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: goal myTideR use R expand TiddlyWiki automatic actions called tides. see action, please see demonstration early version: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kBH73OoaL9o

title: myTideR: Gotta Tiddl' Em All!
text: can install development version myTideR GitHub : Please see Get started examples!
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("andjar/myTideR")

what: Add Filter Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filter_tiddler_to_tiddlywiki
title: Add Filter Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filter_tiddler_to_tiddlywiki
text: internal function adds specified filter tiddlers TiddlyWiki server, enabling use filters via API.

title: Add Filter Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filter_tiddler_to_tiddlywiki
code: add_filter_tiddler_to_tiddlywiki(allow_filters, mws = FALSE)

title: Add Filter Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filter_tiddler_to_tiddlywiki
text: allow_filters Character vector. vector containing filters added. mws Logical. TRUE, sets TiddlyWiki options use "tide" recipe MultiWikiServer. Default FALSE.

what: Add Specific Filters to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filters
title: Add Specific Filters to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filters
text: internal function adds specific set filters TiddlyWiki server, enabling filtering functionality via API.

title: Add Specific Filters to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filters
code: add_filters(mws = FALSE)

title: Add Specific Filters to TiddlyWiki Server — add_filters
text: mws Logical. TRUE, sets TiddlyWiki options use "tide" recipe MultiWikiServer.. Default FALSE.

what: Add Daily Journal Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_journals
title: Add Daily Journal Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_journals
text: internal function adds daily journal tiddlers TiddlyWiki server specified date range. journal entry represented tiddler date title tagged "Journal".

title: Add Daily Journal Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_journals
code: add_journals(   start_date = format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-%m-%d"),   end_date = format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-%m-%d"),   mws = FALSE )

title: Add Daily Journal Tiddlers to TiddlyWiki Server — add_journals
text: start_date Character. start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. Defaults today's date. end_date Character. end date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. Defaults today's date. mws Logical. TRUE, sets TiddlyWiki options use "tide-journal" recipe MultiWikiServer. Default FALSE.

what: Add Settings to TiddlyWiki Server — add_settings
title: Add Settings to TiddlyWiki Server — add_settings
text: internal function adds specific settings tiddlers TiddlyWiki server, configure paths MultiWikiServer (MWS) settings.

title: Add Settings to TiddlyWiki Server — add_settings
code: add_settings(tidepath, mws = FALSE)

title: Add Settings to TiddlyWiki Server — add_settings
text: tidepath Character. path tide folder located. mws Logical. TRUE, sets TiddlyWiki options use "tide" recipe MultiWikiServer. Default FALSE.

title: Create Folder Structure — create_folders
text: internal function creates specific folder structure specified relative path.

title: Create Folder Structure — create_folders
code: create_folders(mypath)

title: Create Folder Structure — create_folders
text: mypath Character. relative path current working directory folders created.

title: Create MultiWikiServer (MWS) for TiddlyWiki — create_mws_server
text: internal function sets MultiWikiServer (MWS) TiddlyWiki specified path, initializing necessary configurations plugins.

title: Create MultiWikiServer (MWS) for TiddlyWiki — create_mws_server
code: create_mws_server(mws_path, tiddlywiki)

title: Create MultiWikiServer (MWS) for TiddlyWiki — create_mws_server
text: mws_path Character. path MWS folder created. tiddlywiki Character. path TiddlyWiki installation.

title: Initialize myTide Setup — init
text: function initializes setup myTide project. sets required folders configurations, optionally starts TiddlyWiki server either MultiWikiServer (MWS) mode regular mode.

title: Initialize myTide Setup — init
code: init(   tidepath = "myTide",   mws = FALSE,   tiddlywiki = NA,   start_date = format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-%m-%d"),   end_date = format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-%m-%d"),   wikipath = NA )

title: Initialize myTide Setup — init
text: tidepath Character. path tide folder created. Default "myTide". mws Logical. Whether set TiddlyWiki server MultiWikiServer mode. Default FALSE. tiddlywiki Character. path TiddlyWiki installation. Default NA. required MWS. start_date Character. start date journal creation YYYY-MM-DD format. Default current date. end_date Character. end date journal creation YYYY-MM-DD format. Default current date. wikipath Character. path wiki data stored. Default NA.

title: Initialize myTide Setup — init
text: function return value sets myTide environment.

title: Initialize myTide Setup — init
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ init() init(tidepath = "customPath", mws = TRUE, tiddlywiki = "path/to/tiddlywiki") } # }

what: Generate Command Text to Start the TiddlyWiki Server — make_run_txt
title: Generate Command Text to Start the TiddlyWiki Server — make_run_txt
text: internal function constructs command text needed start TiddlyWiki server based provided parameters. generated command text can used start server specific configurations.

title: Generate Command Text to Start the TiddlyWiki Server — make_run_txt
code: make_run_txt(tidepath = "myTide", mws = FALSE, tiddlywiki = NA, wikipath = NA)

title: Generate Command Text to Start the TiddlyWiki Server — make_run_txt
text: tidepath Character. path tide folder located. Default "myTide". mws Logical. Indicates whether set TiddlyWiki server Multi-User Server mode. Default FALSE. tiddlywiki Character. path TiddlyWiki installation. Default NA. wikipath Character. path wiki data stored. Default NA.

title: Generate Command Text to Start the TiddlyWiki Server — make_run_txt
text: character string contains command start TiddlyWiki server specified settings.

title: Generate Command Text to Start the TiddlyWiki Server — make_run_txt
code: # Example usage: make_run_txt() #> Error in make_run_txt(): could not find function "make_run_txt" make_run_txt(tidepath = "customPath", mws = TRUE, tiddlywiki = "path/to/tiddlywiki") #> Error in make_run_txt(tidepath = "customPath", mws = TRUE, tiddlywiki = "path/to/tiddlywiki"): could not find function "make_run_txt"

title: Import and Run Tides — run_tides
text: function imports runs tides TiddlyWiki environment. retrieves tides associated scripts, executes order, option force run scripts tagged DoNotRun.

title: Import and Run Tides — run_tides
code: run_tides(force_run = FALSE, mws = FALSE)

title: Import and Run Tides — run_tides
text: force_run Logical. TRUE, also runs scripts tagged DoNotRun. Default FALSE. mws Logical. TRUE, sets TiddlyWiki options use "tides" recipe MultiWikiServer. Default FALSE.

title: Import and Run Tides — run_tides
code: # Run tides with default settings run_tides() #> Error in curl::curl_fetch_memory(url, handle = handle): Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 8080 after 0 ms: Connection refused  # Run tides and force scripts tagged with `DoNotRun` to run run_tides(force_run = TRUE) #> Error in curl::curl_fetch_memory(url, handle = handle): Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 8080 after 0 ms: Connection refused  # Run tides in MultiWikiServer mode run_tides(mws = TRUE) #> Error in curl::curl_fetch_memory(url, handle = handle): Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 8080 after 0 ms: Connection refused

title: Start the TiddlyWiki Server — start_server
text: function starts TiddlyWiki server specified configurations. can start server either MultiWikiServer (MWS) mode regular mode.

title: Start the TiddlyWiki Server — start_server
code: start_server(tidepath = "myTide", mws = FALSE, tiddlywiki = NA, wikipath = NA)

title: Start the TiddlyWiki Server — start_server
text: tidepath Character. path tide folder located. Default "myTide". mws Logical. Indicates whether set TiddlyWiki server MultiWikiServer mode. Default FALSE. tiddlywiki Character. path TiddlyWiki installation. Default NA. wikipath Character. path wiki data stored. Default NA.

title: Start the TiddlyWiki Server — start_server
text: object representing process running TiddlyWiki server.

title: Start the TiddlyWiki Server — start_server
code: # Start the server with default settings p <- start_server() #> Error in c("process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout, ", "    stderr, pty, pty_options, connections, poll_connection, env, "): ! Native call to `processx_exec` failed #> Caused by error in `chain_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), pty, pty_options, …`: #> ! cannot start processx process 'tiddlywiki' (system error 2, No such file or directory) @unix/processx.c:611 (processx_exec)  # Start the server with custom settings p <- start_server(tidepath = "customPath", mws = TRUE, tiddlywiki = "path/to/tiddlywiki", wikipath = "path/to/wiki")

title: Stop the TiddlyWiki Server — stop_server
text: function stops TiddlyWiki server interrupting process.

title: Stop the TiddlyWiki Server — stop_server
code: stop_server(p)

title: Stop the TiddlyWiki Server — stop_server
text: p Process object. process object representing running TiddlyWiki server.

title: Stop the TiddlyWiki Server — stop_server
code: # Start the server p <- start_server() #> Error in c("process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout, ", "    stderr, pty, pty_options, connections, poll_connection, env, "): ! Native call to `processx_exec` failed #> Caused by error in `chain_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), pty, pty_options, …`: #> ! cannot start processx process 'tiddlywiki' (system error 2, No such file or directory) @unix/processx.c:611 (processx_exec)  # Stop the server stop_server(p) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'p' not found
